Understate: The claim understates the existence and usage of the title "Office of the President-elect" during transitions of government in the US.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the title is propaganda and does not exist.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the use of the title by Biden is designed to deceive and manipulate people.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the title is a common and informal term used during the transition period.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that previous president-elects, such as Barack Obama, have also used the title.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of Biden using the title, suggesting it is a form of propaganda and conditioning.
